se.westpay.posapplib

Class TransactionRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.westpay.posapplib.TransactionRequest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CashAdvanceRequest, PurchaseRequest, RefundRequest, ReversalRequest

    public abstract class TransactionRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the details of a new transaction. This class should not be used directly by the POS application. The POS application should instantiate one of the subclasses of this class when a transaction should be performed.
    See Also:
    PurchaseRequest, RefundRequest, CashAdvanceRequest, TransactionResponse

      • TransactionRequest

        public TransactionRequest()
        Constructor.

      • TransactionRequest

        protected TransactionRequest(int currencyId,
                             long totalAmount)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        currencyId - The preferred currency of the transaction.
        totalAmount - The total amount of the transaction, in the small unit of the currency.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrencyId

        public final int getCurrencyId()
        Returns:
        The preferred currency of the transaction.
        See Also:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217

      • setCurrencyId

        public final void setCurrencyId(int value)
        Parameters:
        value - The preferred currency of the transaction. This has to match the currency that is enabled in the payment application configuration.

        The currency is specified using ISO 4217 3-digit codes. Some examples are:

        • 208: DKK
        • 578: NOK
        • 752: SEK
        • 978: EUR
        See Also:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217

      • getDisabledFeatures

        public final java.lang.Enum<PaymentFeatures>[] getDisabledFeatures()
        Returns:
        The features that should be disabled for the transaction.

      • setDisabledFeatures

        public final void setDisabledFeatures(java.lang.Enum<PaymentFeatures>[] features)
        Parameters:
        features - Zero or more features that should be disabled for the transaction.

        Note! Some features rely on the terminal being configured for them, so they might not be enabled just being they are not disabled here.

      • getTotalAmount

        public final long getTotalAmount()
        Returns:
        The total amount of the transaction.

      • setTotalAmount

        public final void setTotalAmount(long value)
        Parameters:
        value - The total amount of the transaction. This amount should include all other amounts, like cashback, or tipping.

        Note! The amount must be specified in the "small unit" of the currency. For example, for EUR the amount must be specified in cents, for SEK it must be specified in ören, and so on. So an amount of 12.50 EUR translates into 1250 cents.

      • getSaleId

        public final java.lang.String getSaleId()
        Returns:
        The sale id of the transaction.

      • setSaleId

        public final void setSaleId(java.lang.String value)
        Parameters:
        value - The sale id of the transaction. The sale id is something the POS application can use to correlate the transaction with its own transaction data. The payment application does not use this value for anything and will just repeat the value in the transaction response.
        See Also:
        TransactionResponse.getSaleId()

      • getLoyaltyApplications

        public final java.lang.String[] getLoyaltyApplications()
        Returns:
        The list of accepted loyalty applications.

      • setLoyaltyApplications

        public final void setLoyaltyApplications(java.lang.String[] applications)
        Parameters:
        applications - A list of names of loyalty applications that should be accepted during the transaction.
